name: epsilon-eag
description: Specification Language for Extended Affix Grammars

eag.skipExecution.description:
Skip running the EAG compiler generator executable defined as eag.executable to generate a compiler and report errors and warnings for EAG grammar specifications.
Changes will be applied after restart. Alternatively, command 'Reload Window' may be executed.

eag.executable.description:
Defines the path to the EAG compiler generator executable which is used to generated compilers and to validate grammars.
In case, a relative path is given then it will be relative to the project's root directory.
Changes will be applied after restart. Alternatively, command 'Reload Window' may be executed.

eag.targetDir.description:
Defines the path to a directory where the generated compiler artifacts will be written to.
In case, a relative path is given then it will be relative to the project's root directory.
Changes will be applied after restart. Alternatively, command 'Reload Window' may be executed.

eag.codeGenerationOnly.description:
Perform code generation only and skip D compilation with DMD (e.g., check if no DMD is installed).
Changes will be applied after restart. Alternatively, command 'Reload Window' may be executed.
(Note: applies the '-g' option)

eag.additionalExeOptions.description:
Defines additional execution arguments which will be added to the EAG compiler generator executable invocation defined by eag.executable
Changes will be applied after restart. Alternatively, command 'Reload Window' may be executed.
